column5: Well just as my luck would have it, on the way into work this morning I blew the motor in the van.    I'm wondering if anyone has any suggestions/recommendations/ for a shop that will fix it in the downtown Toronto to Oshawa area?  It's a 1995 Dodge Caravan with a 3.3.  I just bought it off my grandfather for next to nothing and figure it's worth spending some money on it.  He had the tranny rebuilt a couple of months ago, new exhaust, and the body work done on it last year.  The van is mint.  Well it was a couple of hours ago.  Thanks for your help.
Awe man that just sucks! I hope you it happened either close to home or work! Sorry to hear that Will... let me know where it is now and we'll put our heads together for ya! HH
Thanks HH.  Right now it's parked at work, downtown TO.  Parliment and Richmond area.
Ouch-hope that doesn't put too much of a cramp in your plans.
I've still got the truck so towing the boat is not a problem.    It's just the unexpected repair bill.    When are they ever expected anyways??

I just sent an email to my sis bud.Her soon to be husband rebuilds and builds his own racing engines for his stock car.Im pretty sure he by the airport somewhere. Maybe he can hook ya up with a motor that will make the rest of the kids with rods think twice about racing a mini van.LOL  Can you send me some contact info via pm. Thanks
Thanks Brian,  PM sent.    Edit - HEY!!! I just noticed that I'm now a fishing icon too!  Post 1000!    That sure took long enough.
So your motor really isnt broke then is it POST FREAK..LOL
LOL!  Tell that to the puddle of oil under the van.
If I owned a 12 year old mini van I know how much money I would but into it, 000000  Hit the local wrecker that`s probably your best option.
Put a Hemi in it Dude!!!
3.3 is known for craping out, usually head cracks
Yer Dad knew what he was doing! If money's tight then fix it, if not, don't throw good money after bad.
